goal.ch: This is a graduate course about soft-matter physics. Soft-condensed matter is one of the frontier fields in science nowadays and is the gateway to the vast field of bio-related sciences and new materials. Topics include the theory of solution, polymer chains, and gels, surface tension and wetting, liquid crystals, colloid and Brownian motion, thermal fluctuations, and Diffusion. The only way to learn it well is through reading, thinking, and hard work. Undergraduate knowledge of thermodynamics and statistical physics are prerequisite to joining the class. Emphasis will be on establishing the fundamental concepts and principles as well as training the necessary theoretical tools for research in soft-condensed matter systems. Students should expect to read the textbook regularly and carefully
